content: कलिः [कल्-इनि] {@--1@} Strife, quarrel, dissension, contention; <ls>Śi. 7. 55</ls>: कलिकामजित् <ls>R. 9. 33</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 19.</ls> {@--2@} War, battle {@--3@} The fourth age of the world, the iron age (consisting of 432,000 years of men and beginning from the 13th of February 3102 <ab>B. C.</ab>); <ls>Ms. 1. 86</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 301</ls>; कलिवर्ज्यानि इमानि &c. {@--4@} Kali age personified (this Kali persecuted Nala). {@--5@} The worst of any class. {@--6@} The Bibhītaka tree. {@--7@} The side of a die which is marked with one point. {@--8@} A hero. {@--9@} An arrow. {%--<ab>f.</ab>%} A bud.

कलिका, --कलिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} {@--1@} An unblown flower, a bud; चूतानां चिरनिर्गतापि कलिका बध्नाति न स्वं रजः <ls>Ś. 6. 3</ls>; किमाम्रकलिकाभंगमारभसे <ls>Ś. 6</ls>; <ls>Rs. 6. 17</ls>; <ls>R. 9. 33.</ls> {@--2@} A digit, streak. {@--3@} The bottom or peg of the Indian lute.
